newsitem.title: CROATIA: Croatia's OTC market to launch electronic trading.
newsitem.headline: Croatia's OTC market to launch electronic trading.

text.p: Croatia's over-the-counter market in Varazdin plans to introduce electronic trading within a month, the daily Vjesnik quoted director Marijan Cingula on Friday as saying.
"Computerisation is progressing at such a fast pace in the world that trade without computer back-up is no longer even imaginable," Cingula said.
The Varazdin securities market initially wanted to buy Nasdaq's trading system but has abandoned these plans in favour of developing its own system, he said.
Private firm IGEA was entrusted with designing it and Zagreb-based ESC has already supplied equipment by Digital with the latest software, Cingula added.

Some 35 brokerages that trade on the OTC market have so far communicated with Varazdin only by telephone and fax. Reuter clients can view closing results on page OTCVAR Monday-Friday in the afternoon.
The Zagreb Stock Exchange recently launched an on-line trading system, which will gradually replace simpler off-line communications with member brokerages via modem.

The bourse sees all 46 current members eventually obtaining a direct on-line link to its central computer. It also plans to feed live trading data to Reuters screens. -- Kolumbina Bencevic, Zagreb Newsroom, 385-1-4557075
